definition: (of a sports competition or match) to commence/(of a war or battle) to break out/to perform acrobatic or choreographed fighting (in Chinese opera)/to brawl/to come to blows

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)

sentences.english: Media Tek and MStar Semiconductor initially launched the price war.
sentences.chinese: 联发科和晨星半导体最早开打。

sentences.english: But the US Open tennis tournament is still set to open in New York on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 但是美国网球公开赛仍然计划在周一在纽约开打。

sentences.english: After war began , the two countries broke off diplomatic relations.
sentences.chinese: 战争一旦正式开打，两国就中止了外交关系。

sentences.english: Let us take the law of our sides; let them begin.
sentences.chinese: 先得找点碴儿让我们这边得理，然后就开打。

sentences.english: In other words, it's a product of waiting around for the playoffs to start.
sentences.chinese: 言外之意，这就是说他们只是在坐等季后赛开打。

sentences.english: The two boxers squared off at the center of the ring.
sentences.chinese: 两名拳击手于拳击场中央准备开打。

sentences.english: You're going to have your war anyway.
sentences.chinese: 反正无论如何这个战你一定要开打。

definition: to start a war/to make war/to battle against
to start shooting or firing/to win an initial success/to succeed (of a plan)
to start a match/the kick-off
confrontation/contest/showdown
to meet the enemy head-on
war/to wage war
to pit oneself against sb/to compete with sb/contest/battle/to haggle/to quibble
victory or defeat/the outcome of a battle
to do battle (with sb)
second round (of match, or election)
decisive battle/to fight a decisive battle/to fight for supremacy in ...
quarterfinals
civil war
to cross swords/to have a confrontation (with sb)
skirmish
to whom the deer falls (idiom); the one to emerge victor (i.e. to seize the empire)/prize winner/champion
